title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Ophthalmology & Visual Science
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.Distinction (DI), Pass(PA) or Failure(FA) will be proposed by the supervisor(s) to the Division Head and Department Chairman for comment and endorsement.
outcome: Students are expected to perform literature review, raise scientific question and form study hypothesis for the research project(s) under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
syllabus: 1. Research ideas and concepts 2. Research methods 3. Research design 4. Literature review
required_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.
recommended_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil Ophthalmology & Visual Science
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous year.Seminars will be graded according to the average mark from all attending faculty members based on a standardized making sheet.
outcome: Students are expected to present his/her research project(s), with a detailed literature review, study background, scientific questions and hypothesis, and a preliminary study proposal
syllabus: 1. Critical literature review 2. Research ideas 3. Project design
required_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.
recommended_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in PhD Ophthalmology & Visual Science
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.Distinction (DI), Pass(PA) or Failure (FA) will be proposed by the supervisor(s) to the Division Head and Department Chairman for comment and endorsement.
outcome: Students are expected to design the research project(s), propose study methods and data analysis, and interpret the results under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
syllabus: 1. Bioinformatics & biostatistics 2. Data analysis 3. Data interpretation  4. Manuscript writing
required_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.
recommended_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in PhD Ophthalmology & Visual Science
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous year.Seminars will be graded according to the average mark from all attending faculty members based on a standardized making sheet.
outcome: Students are expected to present his/her research project(s), with adequate literature review, introduction, study hypothesis and aims, methods, results, discussion, and perspectives.
syllabus: 1. Project design 2. Detailed methods 3. Data analysis  4. Interim results and summary 5. Interpretation of results 6. Critical review of relevant topics and discussion  7. Perspectives and future research plan
required_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.
recommended_readings: 1. Student handbook 2. Online literature search for topics relevant to student’s research direction and subjects.

title: Research
requirements: For students in MPhil Ophthalmology & Visual Science
description: To conduct research work on the assigned research topic.Grading of Guided Studies and Research will be proposed by the supervisor(s) to the Division Head and Department Chairman for comment and endorsement.
outcome: Students are expected to conduct the research projects independently, under the supervision of his/her supervisor(s)
required_readings: Online and printed literatures relevant to student’s research projects.
recommended_readings: Online and printed literatures relevant to student’s research projects.
